The lac operon is regulated by the repressor and the CAP (catabolite activator protein). Normally, the operon requires the repressor to be inactive and CAP to bind to activate it. When glucose is available, cAMP levels rise, activating CAP. If glucose is low, cAMP is low, CAP doesn't activate, and the operon remains off until CAP is activated. If the repressor is inactive, the operon is on regardless of CAP activation. However, if the repressor is active, it inhibits the operon even if CAP is active.

In cases where the operon is off, the CAP cannot activate it, so the operon remains silent unless the repressor is inactivated. So, the operon can be constitutively expressed (always on) even without CAP activation if the repressor is inactive. But in the presence of inducer molecules (like allolactose), the repressor is inactivated, allowing RNA polymerase to transcribe the operon even without CAP activation.

So, the presence of wild-type alleles could affect the operon's ability to be induced. If a mutation causes the operon to be off due to lack of CAP activation, then the presence of wild-type alleles could override that and allow the operon to be on via the repressor being inactive.

As a consequence, some mutations can be bypassedin terms of their disruption of theoperonby productionof the partial diploids with wild-type alleles at the sitesof mutation. In each case the wild-type allele is dominant to its mutant homologue. Determine for each of the following partial diploids whetherenzyme production will result constitutively or inducibly(normally) when the inducer molecule is introduced: (a)i^+o^+z^-y^-a^- i^+o^cz^+y^+a^+ (b)i^-o^+z^+y^+a^+ i^+o^+z^+y^-a^- (c)i^+o^cz^+y^-a^- i^-o^+z^-y^-a^-

A. (a) Constitutive synthesis, (b) Inducible, (c) No production of enzymes

B. (a) Constitutive synthesis, (b) Constitutive synthesis, (c) No production of enzymes

C. (a) No production of enzymes, (b) Inducible, (c) Constitutive synthesis

E. (a) Constitutive synthesis, (b) No production of enzymes, (c) Inducible

F. (a) Constitutive synthesis, (b) Inducible, (c) Constitutive synthesis

G. (a) No production of enzymes, (b) No production of enzymes, (c) Inducible

H. (a) Inducible, (b) No production of enzymes, (c) Constitutive synthesis

I. (a) Inducible, (b) Constitutive synthesis, (c) No production of enzymes

J. (a) Inducible, (b) Constitutive synthesis, (c) Inducible
